    • Method Detail

      • spin

        void spin(int wheelSize,
        int initialDelay,
        int finalDelay,
        int delayIncrement,
        WheelCallback callback)
        spin the gaming wheel progressing from the initialDelay to the finalDelay in increments of delayIncrement delays are in milliseconds (ms) 1. begin by selecting a random starting number on the wheel (between 1 and wheelSize) 2. start at initialDelay then increment the delay each time a new number is passed on the wheel 3. call SpinCallback.nextNumber(...) each time a number is passed continue until delay >= finalDelay 4. call SpinCallback.result(...) to finish and process result
        Parameters:
        wheelSize - the size of the wheel from 1 .. wheelSize
        initialDelay - the starting delay in ms between numbers when the wheel starts
        finalDelay - the final delay in ms between numbers when the wheel stops (usually 0)
        delayIncrement - how much the wheel slows down after each number is passed
        callback -
        See Also:
        WheelCallback

      • addPlayer

        void addPlayer(Player player)

      • removePlayer

        boolean removePlayer(Player player)

      • placeBet

        boolean placeBet(Player player,
               java.lang.Integer numberPick,
               int bet)
        Player places abet for a number on the wheel
        Parameters:
        player -
        numberPick - the number they picked
        bet - how many points to bet
        Returns:
        true if the bet is placed false if the player does not have enough points
        See Also:
        Player

      • calculateResult

        void calculateResult(int result)
        engine goes through all players and applies win or loss to points
        Parameters:
        result - the winning number from the wheel

      • getAllPlayers

        java.util.Collection<Player> getAllPlayers()
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all Players
        See Also:
